intro: Diasperus spruceanus, commonly known as the Spruce's Diasperus, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It typically thrives in moist, rocky habitats at high elevations. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
